elements.name: arcgis-portal-classification-banner
elements.description:
### Methods
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component

attributes.name: missing-existing-classification
attributes.description: If the portal item has a classification previously

attributes.name: validation-errors
attributes.description: The classification validation error - validate the classification value against the classification schema.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description:
The size of the banner to display.

- `"full"`: Used when the banner is displayed at the top and bottom of a page. This is the default mode cached for performance.
- `"preview"`: Used when the banner is rendered inside a configuration component. This mode is not cached and is used to display a preview of the classification.

properties.name: missingExistingClassification
properties.description: If the portal item has a classification previously

properties.name: portalItem
properties.description: The portal item to display the classification banner for.

properties.name: validationErrors
properties.description: The classification validation error - validate the classification value against the classification schema.

properties.name: variant
properties.description:
The size of the banner to display.

- `"full"`: Used when the banner is displayed at the top and bottom of a page. This is the default mode cached for performance.
- `"preview"`: Used when the banner is rendered inside a configuration component. This mode is not cached and is used to display a preview of the classification.

elements.name: arcgis-portal-classification-config
elements.description:
The `arcgis-portal-classification-config` component enables users to edit or provide a classification schema to a portal item through a user-friendly form. The schema is saved to the associated portal item.
--

### Events
- **arcgisPropertyChange** - Event emitted when component property values status, values, or valid change.

### Methods
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.
- `destroy(): Promise<void>` - Permanently destroy the component.
- `resetForm(): Promise<void>` - Reset the form to the initial classification values from the portalItem
- `validateForm(): Promise<void>` - Validates the form and sets the formValidationErrors state.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: The loading status of the component, will be set to "loaded" when the classification schema is loaded.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: The validity of the form values against the Portal's classification schema.

attributes.name: values
attributes.description: The edited classification values of the portal item.

events.name: arcgisPropertyChange
events.description: Event emitted when component property values status, values, or valid change.

elements.name: arcgis-portal-field-delete
elements.description:
### Events
- **arcgisBeforeModalClose** - Emitted before the modal is closed if the alert is handled in consumer.
- **arcgisClose** - Emitted when the component is closed for any reason.
- **arcgisFieldsDeleted** - Emitted when the field is successfully deleted.

### Methods
- `componentOnReady(): Promise<void>` - Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.

events.name: arcgisBeforeModalClose
events.description: Emitted before the modal is closed if the alert is handled in consumer.

events.name: arcgisClose
events.description: Emitted when the component is closed for any reason.

events.name: arcgisFieldsDeleted
events.description: Emitted when the field is successfully deleted.

properties.name: layer
properties.description: The layer whose field is being deleted.

properties.name: options
properties.description: Properties that may need to be passed in case values differ from what is available on Map Viewer.
